intro: Epipactis schensiana, commonly known as the Schensian helleborine, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its tall, erect stems and dark green, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, greenish-yellow flowers with a distinctive lip that is often marked with purple or brown spots. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Epipactis schensiana is typically found in temperate climates and is often associated with calcareous soils.
